TextTrackCue.summary: The TextTrackCue interface of the WebVTT API is the abstract base class for the various derived cue types, such as ; you will work with these derived types rather than the base class.

remarks.para: These cues represent strings of text presented for some duration of time during the performance of a . The cue includes the start time (the time at which the text will be displayed) and the end time (the time at which it will be removed from the display), as well as other information.

TextTrackCueEndTime.summary: The endTime property of the interface returns and sets the end time of the cue.
TextTrackCueEndTime.value: A number representing the end time, in seconds.

TextTrackCueStartTime.summary: The startTime property of the interface returns and sets the start time of the cue.
TextTrackCueStartTime.value: A number representing the start time, in seconds.

TextTrackCueExit.summary: The exit event fires when a cue stops being active.

TextTrackCueTrack.summary: The track read-only property of the interface returns the object that this cue belongs to.

TextTrackCueEnter.summary: The enter event fires when a cue becomes active. In the case of subtitles or a caption this is when it displays over the media.

TextTrackCueId.summary: The id property of the interface returns and sets the identifier for this cue.
TextTrackCueId.value: A string containing the ID of this cue.

TextTrackCuePauseOnExit.summary: The pauseOnExit property of the interface returns or sets the flag indicating whether playback of the media should pause when the end of the range to which this cue applies is reached.
TextTrackCuePauseOnExit.value: A , true if the media will pause.
